one_liner: SIS automates irrigation for indoor plants using solar power and rainwater harvesting.
how_it_works: The Sustainable Smart Irrigation System utilizes a solar PV panel to power an Arduino-based control system that manages soil moisture sensors and a water pump. It collects rainwater for irrigation and employs IoT technology to monitor soil moisture levels, adjusting irrigation schedules based on real-time data. The system also sends notifications to users regarding irrigation status via GSM.

steps: 1. Measure soil moisture using the sensor.
2. If moisture is below a threshold, activate the water pump.
3. Use GSM to notify the user about the irrigation status.
4. Collect rainwater and store it in a tank.
5. Calculate daily water requirements based on plant needs.
6. Optimize PV panel size based on energy consumption.
7. Monitor system performance and adjust as necessary.
algorithm.core_equation: output = irrigation_status if soil_moisture < threshold else no_action
algorithm.input_format: Soil moisture data (float), rainfall data (float), energy consumption data (float)
algorithm.output_format: Irrigation status notifications (string), optimized irrigation schedules (schedule object)

parameters.name: PV panel size
parameters.effect: A larger panel can support more energy-intensive operations.

parameters.name: Daily energy consumption
parameters.effect: Lower consumption can extend system operation time.

parameters.name: Soil moisture threshold
parameters.effect: Adjusting this affects when irrigation is triggered.

complexity.time: O(1) for moisture check and pump activation
complexity.space: O(n) for storing moisture data over time
complexity.practical_note: Real-world performance may vary based on environmental conditions and sensor accuracy.

use_when: You need an automated irrigation solution for indoor plants.
You want to reduce water usage and promote sustainability.
You require remote monitoring of irrigation systems.
avoid_when: The project requires high water demand that exceeds rainwater collection capacity.
You need a system that operates without solar power.
You are working in an area with unreliable GSM coverage.
common_mistakes: Not calibrating soil moisture thresholds properly.
Neglecting to monitor energy consumption leading to system failure.

strengths: Reduces water usage significantly compared to traditional methods.
weaknesses: Dependent on solar power and weather conditions.
Limited effectiveness in areas with high water demand.

compared_to.verdict: Use SIS for efficiency and sustainability; traditional systems are less automated.
